sentences.sContent: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.sCn: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.sContent: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.sCn: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.sContent: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.sCn: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.sContent: ...more grown-up ways of doing the same things that are constant sources of joy: making art...
...The result of constant muscle tension and stiffness of joints...
...Are they exhausted by the consumer equivalent of the brain fatigue — information overload — that is caused by constant updates of devices and online media...
...we find that it is long years of will and constant effort that have brought about their success...
...People do it at the expense of everything that was a constant in their lives...
...A constant supply of food should be given until the cold is over and spring has come...

phrases.pCn: 恒流；定量流动；常廉流稳恒流；恒流定量消耗
恒速；固定比率；恒定流量

trans.tranCn: 经常的，不断的，连续发生的；永恒的；忠实的，忠诚的
trans.tranOther: happening regularly or all the time
a number or quantity that never changes
